document.title: Fine Arts Next Generation Sunshine State Standards - Theatre

1D4CB900DFE50131A26568A86D17958E.description: Access Point for Students with Significant Cognitive Disabilities

1D4BF250DFE50131A26368A86D17958E.description: The 21st-century skills necessary for success as citizens, workers, and leaders in a global economy are embedded in the study of the arts.

1D4B2AB0DFE50131A26068A86D17958E.description: Attend to a variety of story characters.

1D49FC40DFE50131A25C68A86D17958E.description: Access Point for Students with Significant Cognitive Disabilities

1D49B270DFE50131A25B68A86D17958E.description: Pretend to be an animal by imitating its movements and sounds.

1D439900DFE50131A24868A86D17958E.description: Identify how the elements of place and time can change a story.

1D434D40DFE50131A24768A86D17958E.description: The arts reflect and document cultural trends and historical events, and help explain how new directions in the arts have emerged.

1D403380DFE50131A23E68A86D17958E.description: Compare a story that is read to one that is acted out.

1D3FD210DFE50131A23D68A86D17958E.description: Every art form uses its own unique language, verbal and non-verbal, to document and communicate with the world.

1D3D7A50DFE50131A23568A86D17958E.description: Draw a picture of a favorite scene from a play.

1D3D1FD0DFE50131A23468A86D17958E.description: The structural rules and conventions of an art form serve as both a foundation and departure point for creativity.

1D3AB7D0DFE50131A22C68A86D17958E.description: Share opinions about a story with classmates.

1D3A68B0DFE50131A22B68A86D17958E.description: Understanding the organizational structure of an art form provides a foundation for appreciation of artistic works and respect for the creative process.

1D398610DFE50131A22868A86D17958E.description: Attend to a variety of stories.

1D370580DFE50131A22068A86D17958E.description: Demonstrate use of the stage space using dramatic play.

1D366100DFE50131A21E68A86D17958E.description: Use imagination to show a person at work, using the body and voice to communicate ideas.

1D361BC0DFE50131A21D68A86D17958E.description: Through purposeful practice, artists learn to manage, master, and refine simple, then complex, skills and techniques.

1D346BE0DFE50131A21868A86D17958E.description: Imitate movements and expressions of familiar story characters.

1D334670DFE50131A21468A86D17958E.description: Development of skills, techniques, and processes in the arts strengthens our ability to remember, focus on, process, and sequence information.

1D2DECF0DFE50131A20368A86D17958E.description: The arts are inherently experiential and actively engage learners in the processes of creating, interpreting, and responding to art.

1D2D4450DFE50131A20168A86D17958E.description: Attend to theatre performances of others.

1D2CB370DFE50131A1FF68A86D17958E.description: Respond to simple theatre performances and media.

1D2B13E0DFE50131A1FA68A86D17958E.description: Share reactions to a live theatre performance.

1D2ACDB0DFE50131A1F968A86D17958E.description: Recognize that individuals may like different things about a selected story or play.

1D2A8420DFE50131A1F868A86D17958E.description: The processes of critiquing works of art lead to development of critical-thinking skills transferable to other contexts.

1D2A3630DFE50131A1F768A86D17958E.description: Attend to a variety of theatre productions and media.

1D2804B0DFE50131A1F068A86D17958E.description: Respond to a performance and share personal preferences about parts of the performance.

1D27B180DFE50131A1EF68A86D17958E.description: Assessing our own and others' artistic work, using critical-thinking, problem-solving, and decision-making skills, is central to artistic growth.

1D263F60DFE50131A1EA68A86D17958E.description: Associate sounds and movements with story characters.

1D254B80DFE50131A1E768A86D17958E.description: Create a story about an everyday event involving family members and/or pets using body movements, sounds, and imagination.

1D24FE80DFE50131A1E668A86D17958E.description: Cognition and reflection are required to appreciate, interpret, and create with artistic intent.
